answers.answer: I would mention this to your GP. They'll want to rule out diabetes and MS. It's probably nothing serious, but it wouldn't hurt to get checked out. It could be as simple as a Vitamin-B deficiency.Warm wishes,AT

question: I have been seeing a Chiropractor for an issue I was having with my foot.  The pain was so great I had to give up jogging.  It was in the arch of my foot.  Good news I really feel like that has been helped.   However something new has happened.  It started a few weeks ago my right toes go numb.  It last from a few minutes to 30 mins several times a day.  In the last week my other foot is now doing the same thing... at the same time the other one is numb.  Today both feet and my right hand went numb while I was out to lunch.   It doesnt seem to matter if I am sitting or standing.   I thought the first on set of the issues was maybe just related to some of the healing process.  I havent talked to my Chiropractor about this yet.   After reading articles on the internet I am concerned I maybe should call my GP instead.  I am a healthy, 40 yr old woman.  I take no medications just vitamin sup....  What are your thoughts?
title: Numbness in my toes
